title: Nvidia heads toward $2 trillion market cap after blowout forecast
text: ** Shares of Nvidia NVDA jump 13.9% to $768.8 in premarket trading - on track to hit a record high at market open ** The chip designer forecast a roughly threefold surge in quarterly revenue that handily beat estimates as it banked on towering demand for its artificial-intelligence (AI) chips ** Stock set to add more than $230 bln in market cap, taking it closer to the $2 trillion mark for the first time ** Co also forecast Q1 revenue growth of 233%, ahead of Wall St est of 208% growth ** Thursday's early gains put Nvidia on track to reclaim the title of the third most valuable U.S. company, behind Microsoft MSFT and Apple AAPL ** U.S.-listed shares of British chip designer Arm Holdings ARM, ARM gains 9.6%, Super Micro Computer SMCI, seen as a big beneficiary of strong AI technology demand, jumps 14.6% ** Other chipmaker Advanced Micro Devices AMD up 5.9% ** Smaller AI firms: Bigbear.ai BBAI climbs 9.3%, C3.ai AI up 6.5%, SoundHound AI SOUN rallies 8.8% ** VanEck Semiconductor ETF SMH up 5.8%, iShares Semiconductor ETF SOXX adds 4.0% ** Low-float Beamr Imaging BMR, an Israel-based video software maker that said last week it would present research relating to automated video modernization with Nvidia, rallies 23.0% Traders and investors use our platform.
